heading: The Temple of Esna
text: picked temple Esna start several reasons. First , spent several years University Basel studying peculiar Roman Period hieroglyphic spellings temple, part interdisciplinary eikones project. Second, inscriptions notoriously difficult, thus largely inaccessible non-specialists. original editor, Serge Sauneron Sauneron 1962, translated important hymns festival texts, finish works local theology untimely death. Significant portions translated specialized monographs, notably last 20 years (e.g. . von Lieven 2000; Recklinghausen, Derchain 2004; Elgawady 2016, Fernández Pichel 2018; Leitz, Löffler 2019; Vadas 2020). detailed references individual passages can found index temple texts.Nonetheless remain many individual offering scenes, bandeaus, interstitial texts great interest. final impetus project came original publishers hieroglyphic text editions, IFAO, released published volumes open-access PDFs 2021. Please buy download PDFs soon possible.first goal, working exclusively Roman Period inscriptions Esna II (scenes 46-193). far, 148/148 (100%) scenes complete online. moved translating Esna III, continue update proofread Esna II, especially find parallels clues improved readings elsewhere.

heading: Esna 126
text: Location: Interior Eastern wall, right cornerDate: UnknownHieroglyphic TextBibliography: Leitz 2001 (complete)inscription much difficult corresponding ram hymn Esna 103. former, rams wear different crowns, rest upon various signs, feature attributes (e.g. wings), attributes rare, primarily two types crocodiles, interspersed occasionally hieroglyphs reading aids.Unfortunately, large portions text illegible, since attributes additional signs lost lacunae. earlier copy made Lepsius expedition, unclear many rams partially restored, whether early copy correctly noted individual features.ram hymn, text merits detailed analysis, space format. now, one may consult heroic efforts Leitz 2001. Just note certain proposals given , ingenious, always verifiable; example, reading group 17 identical crocodiles “father fathers.”

heading: Esna 141
text: Location: Intercolumnar Wall CDate: HadrianHieroglyphic TextBibliography: Elgawady 2016, pp. 203-205.PhotographThis potentially significant scene. Bas Pe Nekhen carry Roman emperor Hadrian sedan chair, just celebrating classical Pharaonic jubilee (Sed Festival). Similar reliefs can found Karnak Ramesses II Ramesses III. Hadrian actually visited Upper Egypt 130-131 CE, including trips famous monuments Colossus Memnon Western Thebes, reportedly interacted closely local Egyptian clergy.367This unique relief fit intercolumnar scenes Esna, otherwise show well-attested ritual sequence building temple seeing chief divinities. Nonetheless, similar scenes king carried sedan chair can accompany scenes “appearing palace”, depicted Esna 52 Esna 74.368 Since surrounding reliefs decorated Domitian, including inscriptions immediately scene ([Esna 139), Esna 140), tempting speculate scene commemorates visit Hadrian temple Esna. least, seems cartouches finished reign. royal names carved beneath feet (, 12) closely resemble name predecessor, Trajan.

heading: Esna 192 B
text:

good youth,
created beginning,
great child, beautiful face,

seeing(?)578 .
child [..]
rises Nun,
son mighty ruler
great young man within […]
